_CC_DEFAULT_SETTINGS.name: _CC_DEFAULT_SETTINGS
_CC_DEFAULT_SETTINGS.summary: The default computer settings as defined in the ComputerCraft configuration.

_G.name: _G
_G.summary: Functions in the global environment, defined in bios.lua.

_HOST.name: _HOST
_HOST.summary: Stores the current ComputerCraft and Minecraft versions.

alarm.name: alarm
alarm.summary: The alarm event is fired when an alarm started with os.setAlarm completes.

cc.audio.dfpwm.name: cc.audio.dfpwm
cc.audio.dfpwm.summary: Convert between streams of DFPWM audio data and a list of amplitudes.

cc.audio.dfpwm.decode.name: cc.audio.dfpwm.decode(input)
cc.audio.dfpwm.decode.summary: A convenience function for decoding a complete file of audio at once.

cc.audio.dfpwm.encode.name: cc.audio.dfpwm.encode(input)
cc.audio.dfpwm.encode.summary: A convenience function for encoding a complete file of audio at once.

cc.audio.dfpwm.make_decoder.name: cc.audio.dfpwm.make_decoder()
cc.audio.dfpwm.make_decoder.summary: Create a new decoder for converting DFPWM into PCM audio data.

cc.audio.dfpwm.make_encoder.name: cc.audio.dfpwm.make_encoder()
cc.audio.dfpwm.make_encoder.summary: Create a new encoder for converting PCM audio data into DFPWM.

cc.completion.name: cc.completion
cc.completion.summary: A collection of helper methods for working with input completion, such as that require by _G.read.

cc.completion.choice.name: cc.completion.choice(text, choices [, add_space])
cc.completion.choice.summary: Complete from a choice of one or more strings.

cc.completion.command.name: cc.completion.command(text [, add_space])
cc.completion.command.summary: Complete the name of a Minecraft command.

cc.completion.peripheral.name: cc.completion.peripheral(text [, add_space])
cc.completion.peripheral.summary: Complete the name of a currently attached peripheral.

cc.completion.side.name: cc.completion.side(text [, add_space])
cc.completion.side.summary: Complete the side of a computer.

cc.expect.name: cc.expect
cc.expect.summary: The cc.expect library provides helper functions for verifying that function arguments are well-formed and of the correct type.

cc.expect.expect.name: cc.expect.expect(index, value, ...)
cc.expect.expect.summary: Expect an argument to have a specific type.

cc.expect.field.name: cc.expect.field(tbl, index, ...)
cc.expect.field.summary: Expect an field to have a specific type.

cc.expect.range.name: cc.expect.range(num, min, max)
cc.expect.range.summary: Expect a number to be within a specific range.

cc.image.nft.name: cc.image.nft
cc.image.nft.summary: Read and draw nft ("Nitrogen Fingers Text") images.

cc.image.nft.draw.name: cc.image.nft.draw(image, xPos, xPos [, target])
cc.image.nft.draw.summary: Draw an nft image to the screen.

cc.image.nft.load.name: cc.image.nft.load(path)
cc.image.nft.load.summary: Load an nft image from a file.

cc.image.nft.parse.name: cc.image.nft.parse(image)
cc.image.nft.parse.summary: Parse an nft image from a string.

cc.pretty.name: cc.pretty
cc.pretty.summary: A pretty printer for rendering data structures in an aesthetically pleasing manner.

cc.pretty.Doc.name: cc.pretty.Doc
cc.pretty.Doc.summary: A document containing formatted text, with multiple possible layouts.

cc.pretty.group.name: cc.pretty.group(doc)
cc.pretty.group.summary: Builds a document which is displayed on a single line if there is enough room, or as normal if not.

cc.pretty.nest.name: cc.pretty.nest(depth, doc)
cc.pretty.nest.summary: Indent later lines of the given document with the given number of spaces.

cc.pretty.pretty.name: cc.pretty.pretty(obj [, options])
cc.pretty.pretty.summary: Pretty-print an arbitrary object, converting it into a document.

cc.pretty.pretty_print.name: cc.pretty.pretty_print(obj [, options [, ribbon_frac=0.6]])
cc.pretty.pretty_print.summary: A shortcut for calling pretty and print together.

cc.pretty.print.name: cc.pretty.print(doc [, ribbon_frac=0.6])
cc.pretty.print.summary: Display a document on the terminal with a trailing new line.

cc.pretty.render.name: cc.pretty.render(doc [, width [, ribbon_frac=0.6]])
cc.pretty.render.summary: Render a document, converting it into a string.

cc.pretty.space.name: cc.pretty.space
cc.pretty.space.summary: A document with a single space in it.

cc.pretty.text.name: cc.pretty.text(text [, colour])
cc.pretty.text.summary: Create a new document from a string.

cc.pretty.write.name: cc.pretty.write(doc [, ribbon_frac=0.6])
cc.pretty.write.summary: Display a document on the terminal.

cc.require.name: cc.require
cc.require.summary: A pure Lua implementation of the builtin require function and package library.

cc.require.make.name: cc.require.make(env, dir)
cc.require.make.summary: Build an implementation of Lua's package library, and a require function to load modules within it.

cc.shell.completion.name: cc.shell.completion
cc.shell.completion.summary: A collection of helper methods for working with shell completion.

cc.shell.completion.build.name: cc.shell.completion.build(...)
cc.shell.completion.build.summary: A helper function for building shell completion arguments.

cc.shell.completion.choice.name: cc.shell.completion.choice
cc.shell.completion.choice.summary: Wraps cc.completion.choice as a build compatible function.

cc.shell.completion.command.name: cc.shell.completion.command
cc.shell.completion.command.summary: Wraps cc.completion.command as a build compatible function.

cc.shell.completion.dir.name: cc.shell.completion.dir(shell, text)
cc.shell.completion.dir.summary: Complete the name of a directory relative to the current working directory.

cc.shell.completion.dirOrFile.name: cc.shell.completion.dirOrFile(shell, text, previous [, add_space])
cc.shell.completion.dirOrFile.summary: Complete the name of a file or directory relative to the current working directory.

cc.shell.completion.file.name: cc.shell.completion.file(shell, text)
cc.shell.completion.file.summary: Complete the name of a file relative to the current working directory.

cc.shell.completion.help.name: cc.shell.completion.help
cc.shell.completion.help.summary: Wraps help.completeTopic as a build compatible function.

cc.shell.completion.peripheral.name: cc.shell.completion.peripheral
cc.shell.completion.peripheral.summary: Wraps cc.completion.peripheral as a build compatible function.

cc.shell.completion.program.name: cc.shell.completion.program(shell, text)
cc.shell.completion.program.summary: Complete the name of a program.

cc.shell.completion.setting.name: cc.shell.completion.setting
cc.shell.completion.setting.summary: Wraps cc.completion.setting as a build compatible function.

cc.shell.completion.side.name: cc.shell.completion.side
cc.shell.completion.side.summary: Wraps cc.completion.side as a build compatible function.

cc.strings.name: cc.strings
cc.strings.summary: Various utilities for working with strings and text.

cc.strings.ensure_width.name: cc.strings.ensure_width(line [, width])
cc.strings.ensure_width.summary: Makes the input string a fixed width.

cc.strings.wrap.name: cc.strings.wrap(text [, width])
cc.strings.wrap.summary: Wraps a block of text, so that each line fits within the given width.

char.name: char
char.summary: The char event is fired when a character is typed on the keyboard.

colors.name: colors
colors.summary: Constants and functions for colour values, suitable for working with term and redstone.

colors.black.name: colors.black = 0x8000
colors.black.summary: Black: Written as f in paint files and term.blit, has a default terminal colour of #111111.

colors.blue.name: colors.blue = 0x800
colors.blue.summary: Blue: Written as b in paint files and term.blit, has a default terminal colour of #3366CC.

colors.brown.name: colors.brown = 0x1000
colors.brown.summary: Brown: Written as c in paint files and term.blit, has a default terminal colour of #7F664C.

colors.combine.name: colors.combine(...)
colors.combine.summary: Combines a set of colors (or sets of colors) into a larger set.

colors.cyan.name: colors.cyan = 0x200
colors.cyan.summary: Cyan: Written as 9 in paint files and term.blit, has a default terminal colour of #4C99B2.

colors.fromBlit.name: colors.fromBlit(hex)
colors.fromBlit.summary: Converts the given paint/blit hex character (0-9a-f) to a color.

colors.gray.name: colors.gray = 0x80
colors.gray.summary: Gray: Written as 7 in paint files and term.blit, has a default terminal colour of #4C4C4C.

colors.green.name: colors.green = 0x2000
colors.green.summary: Green: Written as d in paint files and term.blit, has a default terminal colour of #57A64E.

colors.lightBlue.name: colors.lightBlue = 0x8
colors.lightBlue.summary: Light blue: Written as 3 in paint files and term.blit, has a default terminal colour of #99B2F2.

colors.lightGray.name: colors.lightGray = 0x100
colors.lightGray.summary: Light gray: Written as 8 in paint files and term.blit, has a default terminal colour of #999999.

colors.lime.name: colors.lime = 0x20
colors.lime.summary: Lime: Written as 5 in paint files and term.blit, has a default terminal colour of #7FCC19.

colors.magenta.name: colors.magenta = 0x4
colors.magenta.summary: Magenta: Written as 2 in paint files and term.blit, has a default terminal colour of #E57FD8.

colors.orange.name: colors.orange = 0x2
colors.orange.summary: Orange: Written as 1 in paint files and term.blit, has a default terminal colour of #F2B233.

colors.packRGB.name: colors.packRGB(r, g, b)
colors.packRGB.summary: Combine a three-colour RGB value into one hexadecimal representation.

colors.pink.name: colors.pink = 0x40
colors.pink.summary: Pink: Written as 6 in paint files and term.blit, has a default terminal colour of #F2B2CC.

colors.purple.name: colors.purple = 0x400
colors.purple.summary: Purple: Written as a in paint files and term.blit, has a default terminal colour of #B266E5.

colors.red.name: colors.red = 0x4000
colors.red.summary: Red: Written as e in paint files and term.blit, has a default terminal colour of #CC4C4C.

colors.rgb8.name: colors.rgb8(...)
colors.rgb8.summary: Either calls colors.packRGB or colors.unpackRGB, depending on how many arguments it receives.

colors.subtract.name: colors.subtract(colors, ...)
colors.subtract.summary: Removes one or more colors (or sets of colors) from an initial set.

colors.test.name: colors.test(colors, color)
colors.test.summary: Tests whether color is contained within colors.

colors.toBlit.name: colors.toBlit(color)
colors.toBlit.summary: Converts the given color to a paint/blit hex character (0-9a-f).

colors.unpackRGB.name: colors.unpackRGB(rgb)
colors.unpackRGB.summary: Separate a hexadecimal RGB colour into its three constituent channels.

colors.white.name: colors.white = 0x1
colors.white.summary: White: Written as 0 in paint files and term.blit, has a default terminal colour of #F0F0F0.

colors.yellow.name: colors.yellow = 0x10
colors.yellow.summary: Yellow: Written as 4 in paint files and term.blit, has a default terminal colour of #DEDE6C.

colours.name: colours
colours.summary: An alternative version of colors for lovers of British spelling.

commands.name: commands
commands.summary: Execute Minecraft commands and gather data from the results from a command computer.

commands.async.name: commands.async
commands.async.summary: A table containing asynchronous wrappers for all commands.

commands.native.name: commands.native
commands.native.summary: The builtin commands API, without any generated command helper functions

computer_command.name: computer_command
computer_command.summary: The computer_command event is fired when the /computercraft queue command is run for the current computer.

disk.eject.name: disk.eject(name)
disk.eject.summary: Ejects any item currently in the drive, spilling it into the world as a loose item.

disk.getAudioTitle.name: disk.getAudioTitle(name)
disk.getAudioTitle.summary: Get the title of the audio track from the music record in the drive.

disk.getID.name: disk.getID(name)
disk.getID.summary: Returns a number which uniquely identifies the disk in the drive.

disk.getLabel.name: disk.getLabel(name)
disk.getLabel.summary: Get the label of the floppy disk, record, or other media within the given disk drive.

disk.getMountPath.name: disk.getMountPath(name)
disk.getMountPath.summary: Find the directory name on the local computer where the contents of the current floppy disk (or other mount) can be found.

disk.hasAudio.name: disk.hasAudio(name)
disk.hasAudio.summary: Whether the current disk is a music disk as opposed to a floppy disk or other item.

disk.hasData.name: disk.hasData(name)
disk.hasData.summary: Check whether the current disk provides a mount.

disk.isPresent.name: disk.isPresent(name)
disk.isPresent.summary: Checks whether any item at all is in the disk drive

disk.playAudio.name: disk.playAudio(name)
disk.playAudio.summary: Starts playing the music record in the drive.

disk.setLabel.name: disk.setLabel(name, label)
disk.setLabel.summary: Set the label of the floppy disk or other media

disk.stopAudio.name: disk.stopAudio(name)
disk.stopAudio.summary: Stops the music record in the drive from playing, if it was started with disk.playAudio.

disk_eject.name: disk_eject
disk_eject.summary: The disk_eject event is fired when a disk is removed from an adjacent or networked disk drive.

event!disk.name: disk
event!disk.summary: The disk event is fired when a disk is inserted into an adjacent or networked disk drive.

event!peripheral.name: peripheral
event!peripheral.summary: The peripheral event is fired when a peripheral is attached on a side or to a modem.

feature_compat.name: Lua 5.2/5.3 features in CC: Tweaked
feature_compat.summary: CC: Tweaked is based off of the Cobalt Lua runtime, which uses Lua 5.

file_transfer.name: file_transfer
file_transfer.summary: The file_transfer event is queued when a user drags-and-drops a file on an open computer.

fs.complete.name: fs.complete(...)
fs.complete.summary: Provides completion for a file or directory name, suitable for use with _G.read.

fs.find.name: fs.find(path)
fs.find.summary: Searches for files matching a string with wildcards.

fs.isDriveRoot.name: fs.isDriveRoot(path)
fs.isDriveRoot.summary: Returns true if a path is mounted to the parent filesystem.

gps.name: gps
gps.summary: Use modems to locate the position of the current turtle or computers.

gps.CHANNEL_GPS.name: gps.CHANNEL_GPS = 65534
gps.CHANNEL_GPS.summary: The channel which GPS requests and responses are broadcast on.

gps.locate.name: gps.locate([timeout=2 [, debug=false]])
gps.locate.summary: Tries to retrieve the computer or turtles own location.

gps_setup.name: Setting up GPS
gps_setup.summary: The gps API allows computers and turtles to find their current position using wireless modems.

help.name: help
help.summary: Find help files on the current computer.

help.completeTopic.name: help.completeTopic(prefix)
help.completeTopic.summary: Returns a list of topic endings that match the prefix.

help.lookup.name: help.lookup(topic)
help.lookup.summary: Returns the location of the help file for the given topic.

help.path.name: help.path()
help.path.summary: Returns a colon-separated list of directories where help files are searched for.

help.setPath.name: help.setPath(newPath)
help.setPath.summary: Sets the colon-separated list of directories where help files are searched for to newPath

help.topics.name: help.topics()
help.topics.summary: Returns a list of topics that can be looked up and/or displayed.

http.name: http
http.summary: Make HTTP requests, sending and receiving data to a remote web server.

http.checkURL.name: http.checkURL(url)
http.checkURL.summary: Determine whether a URL can be requested.

http.checkURLAsync.name: http.checkURLAsync(url)
http.checkURLAsync.summary: Asynchronously determine whether a URL can be requested.

http.get.name: http.get(...)
http.get.summary: Make a HTTP GET request to the given url.

http.post.name: http.post(...)
http.post.summary: Make a HTTP POST request to the given url.

http.request.name: http.request(...)
http.request.summary: Asynchronously make a HTTP request to the given url.

http_check.name: http_check
http_check.summary: The http_check event is fired when a URL check finishes.

http_failure.name: http_failure
http_failure.summary: The http_failure event is fired when an HTTP request fails.

http_success.name: http_success
http_success.summary: The http_success event is fired when an HTTP request returns successfully.

io.Handle.name: io.Handle
io.Handle.summary: A file handle which can be read or written to.

io.Handle.close.name: io.Handle.close()
io.Handle.close.summary: Close this file handle, freeing any resources it uses.

io.Handle.flush.name: io.Handle.flush()
io.Handle.flush.summary: Flush any buffered output, forcing it to be written to the file

io.Handle.lines.name: io.Handle.lines(...)
io.Handle.lines.summary: Returns an iterator that, each time it is called, returns a new line from the file.

io.Handle.read.name: io.Handle.read(...)
io.Handle.read.summary: Reads data from the file, using the specified formats.

io.Handle.seek.name: io.Handle.seek([whence [, offset]])
io.Handle.seek.summary: Seeks the file cursor to the specified position, and returns the new position.

io.Handle.setvbuf.name: io.Handle.setvbuf(mode [, size])
io.Handle.setvbuf.summary: Sets the buffering mode for an output file.

io.Handle.write.name: io.Handle.write(...)
io.Handle.write.summary: Write one or more values to the file

io.input.name: io.input([file])
io.input.summary: Get or set the current input file.

io.lines.name: io.lines([filename, ...])
io.lines.summary: Opens the given file name in read mode and returns an iterator that, each time it is called, returns a new line from the file.

io.open.name: io.open(filename [, mode])
io.open.summary: Open a file with the given mode, either returning a new file handle or nil, plus an error message.

io.output.name: io.output([file])
io.output.summary: Get or set the current output file.

io.read.name: io.read(...)
io.read.summary: Read from the currently opened input file.

io.stderr.name: io.stderr
io.stderr.summary: A file handle representing the "standard error" stream.

io.stdin.name: io.stdin
io.stdin.summary: A file handle representing the "standard input".

io.stdout.name: io.stdout
io.stdout.summary: A file handle representing the "standard output".

io.type.name: io.type(obj)
io.type.summary: Checks whether handle is a given file handle, and determine if it is open or not.

io.write.name: io.write(...)
io.write.summary: Write to the currently opened output file.

key.name: key
key.summary: This event is fired when any key is pressed while the terminal is focused.

key_up.name: key_up
key_up.summary: Fired whenever a key is released (or the terminal is closed while a key was being pressed).

keys.name: keys
keys.summary: Constants for all keyboard "key codes", as queued by the key event.

keys.getName.name: keys.getName(code)
keys.getName.summary: Translates a numerical key code to a human-readable name.

local_ips.name: Allowing access to local IPs
local_ips.summary: By default, ComputerCraft blocks access to local IP addresses for security.

modem_message.name: modem_message
modem_message.summary: The modem_message event is fired when a message is received on an open channel on any modem.

monitor_resize.name: monitor_resize
monitor_resize.summary: The monitor_resize event is fired when an adjacent or networked monitor's size is changed.

monitor_touch.name: monitor_touch
monitor_touch.summary: The monitor_touch event is fired when an adjacent or networked Advanced Monitor is right-clicked.

mouse_click.name: mouse_click
mouse_click.summary: This event is fired when the terminal is clicked with a mouse.

mouse_drag.name: mouse_drag
mouse_drag.summary: This event is fired every time the mouse is moved while a mouse button is being held.

mouse_scroll.name: mouse_scroll
mouse_scroll.summary: This event is fired when a mouse wheel is scrolled in the terminal.

mouse_up.name: mouse_up
mouse_up.summary: This event is fired when a mouse button is released or a held mouse leaves the computer's terminal.

multishell.name: multishell
multishell.summary: Multishell allows multiple programs to be run at the same time.

multishell.getCount.name: multishell.getCount()
multishell.getCount.summary: Get the number of processes within this multishell.

multishell.getCurrent.name: multishell.getCurrent()
multishell.getCurrent.summary: Get the index of the currently running process.

multishell.getTitle.name: multishell.getTitle(n)
multishell.getTitle.summary: Get the title of the given tab.

multishell.launch.name: multishell.launch(tProgramEnv, sProgramPath, ...)
multishell.launch.summary: Start a new process, with the given environment, program and arguments.

multishell.setTitle.name: multishell.setTitle(n, title)
multishell.setTitle.summary: Set the title of the given process.

os.loadAPI.name: os.loadAPI(path)
os.loadAPI.summary: Loads the given API into the global environment.

os.pullEvent.name: os.pullEvent([filter])
os.pullEvent.summary: Pause execution of the current thread and waits for any events matching filter.

os.pullEventRaw.name: os.pullEventRaw([filter])
os.pullEventRaw.summary: Pause execution of the current thread and waits for events, including the terminate event.

os.run.name: os.run(env, path, ...)
os.run.summary: Run the program at the given path with the specified environment and arguments.

os.sleep.name: os.sleep(time)
os.sleep.summary: Pauses execution for the specified number of seconds, alias of _G.sleep.

os.unloadAPI.name: os.unloadAPI(name)
os.unloadAPI.summary: Unloads an API which was loaded by os.loadAPI.

os.version.name: os.version()
os.version.summary: Get the current CraftOS version (for example, CraftOS 1.8).

paintutils.name: paintutils
paintutils.summary: Utilities for drawing more complex graphics, such as pixels, lines and images.

paintutils.drawBox.name: paintutils.drawBox(startX, startY, endX, endY [, colour])
paintutils.drawBox.summary: Draws the outline of a box on the current term from the specified start position to the specified end position.

paintutils.drawFilledBox.name: paintutils.drawFilledBox(startX, startY, endX, endY [, colour])
paintutils.drawFilledBox.summary: Draws a filled box on the current term from the specified start position to the specified end position.

paintutils.drawImage.name: paintutils.drawImage(image, xPos, yPos)
paintutils.drawImage.summary: Draw an image loaded by paintutils.parseImage or paintutils.loadImage.

paintutils.drawLine.name: paintutils.drawLine(startX, startY, endX, endY [, colour])
paintutils.drawLine.summary: Draws a straight line from the start to end position.

paintutils.drawPixel.name: paintutils.drawPixel(xPos, yPos [, colour])
paintutils.drawPixel.summary: Draws a single pixel to the current term at the specified position.

paintutils.loadImage.name: paintutils.loadImage(path)
paintutils.loadImage.summary: Loads an image from a file.

paintutils.parseImage.name: paintutils.parseImage(image)
paintutils.parseImage.summary: Parses an image from a multi-line string

parallel.name: parallel
parallel.summary: A simple way to run several functions at once.

parallel.waitForAll.name: parallel.waitForAll(...)
parallel.waitForAll.summary: Switches between execution of the functions, until all of them are finished.

parallel.waitForAny.name: parallel.waitForAny(...)
parallel.waitForAny.summary: Switches between execution of the functions, until any of them finishes.

paste.name: paste
paste.summary: The paste event is fired when text is pasted into the computer through Ctrl-V (or ⌘V on Mac).

peripheral.name: peripheral
peripheral.summary: Find and control peripherals attached to this computer.

peripheral.call.name: peripheral.call(name, method, ...)
peripheral.call.summary: Call a method on the peripheral with the given name.

peripheral.find.name: peripheral.find(ty [, filter])
peripheral.find.summary: Find all peripherals of a specific type, and return the wrapped peripherals.

peripheral.getMethods.name: peripheral.getMethods(name)
peripheral.getMethods.summary: Get all available methods for the peripheral with the given name.

peripheral.getName.name: peripheral.getName(peripheral)
peripheral.getName.summary: Get the name of a peripheral wrapped with peripheral.wrap.

peripheral.getNames.name: peripheral.getNames()
peripheral.getNames.summary: Provides a list of all peripherals available.

peripheral.getType.name: peripheral.getType(peripheral)
peripheral.getType.summary: Get the types of a named or wrapped peripheral.

peripheral.hasType.name: peripheral.hasType(peripheral, peripheral_type)
peripheral.hasType.summary: Check if a peripheral is of a particular type.

peripheral.isPresent.name: peripheral.isPresent(name)
peripheral.isPresent.summary: Determines if a peripheral is present with the given name.

peripheral.wrap.name: peripheral.wrap(name)
peripheral.wrap.summary: Get a table containing all functions available on a peripheral.

peripheral_detach.name: peripheral_detach
peripheral_detach.summary: The peripheral_detach event is fired when a peripheral is detached from a side or from a modem.

print.name: print(...)
print.summary: Prints the specified values to the screen separated by spaces, wrapping if necessary.

printError.name: printError(...)
printError.summary: Prints the specified values to the screen in red, separated by spaces, wrapping if necessary.

read.name: read([replaceChar [, history [, completeFn [, default]]]])
read.summary: Reads user input from the terminal.

rednet.name: rednet
rednet.summary: Communicate with other computers by using modems.

rednet.CHANNEL_BROADCAST.name: rednet.CHANNEL_BROADCAST = 65535
rednet.CHANNEL_BROADCAST.summary: The channel used by the Rednet API to broadcast messages.

rednet.CHANNEL_REPEAT.name: rednet.CHANNEL_REPEAT = 65533
rednet.CHANNEL_REPEAT.summary: The channel used by the Rednet API to repeat messages.

rednet.MAX_ID_CHANNELS.name: rednet.MAX_ID_CHANNELS = 65500
rednet.MAX_ID_CHANNELS.summary: The number of channels rednet reserves for computer IDs.

rednet.broadcast.name: rednet.broadcast(message [, protocol])
rednet.broadcast.summary: Broadcasts a string message over the predefined CHANNEL_BROADCAST channel.

rednet.close.name: rednet.close([modem])
rednet.close.summary: Close a modem with the given peripheral name, meaning it can no longer send and receive rednet messages.

rednet.host.name: rednet.host(protocol, hostname)
rednet.host.summary: Register the system as "hosting" the desired protocol under the specified name.

rednet.isOpen.name: rednet.isOpen([modem])
rednet.isOpen.summary: Determine if rednet is currently open.

rednet.lookup.name: rednet.lookup(protocol [, hostname])
rednet.lookup.summary: Search the local rednet network for systems hosting the desired protocol and returns any computer IDs that respond as "r...

rednet.open.name: rednet.open(modem)
rednet.open.summary: Opens a modem with the given peripheral name, allowing it to send and receive messages over rednet.

rednet.receive.name: rednet.receive([protocol_filter [, timeout]])
rednet.receive.summary: Wait for a rednet message to be received, or until nTimeout seconds have elapsed.

rednet.run.name: rednet.run()
rednet.run.summary: Listen for modem messages and converts them into rednet messages, which may then be received.

rednet.send.name: rednet.send(recipient, message [, protocol])
rednet.send.summary: Allows a computer or turtle with an attached modem to send a message intended for a sycomputer with a specific ID.

rednet.unhost.name: rednet.unhost(protocol)
rednet.unhost.summary: Stop hosting a specific protocol, meaning it will no longer respond to rednet.lookup requests.

rednet_message.name: rednet_message
rednet_message.summary: The rednet_message event is fired when a message is sent over Rednet.

redstone.name: redstone
redstone.summary: The redstone event is fired whenever any redstone inputs on the computer change.

settings.name: settings
settings.summary: Read and write configuration options for CraftOS and your programs.

settings.clear.name: settings.clear()
settings.clear.summary: Resets the value of all settings.

settings.define.name: settings.define(name [, options])
settings.define.summary: Define a new setting, optional specifying various properties about it.

settings.get.name: settings.get(name [, default])
settings.get.summary: Get the value of a setting.

settings.getDetails.name: settings.getDetails(name)
settings.getDetails.summary: Get details about a specific setting.

settings.getNames.name: settings.getNames()
settings.getNames.summary: Get the names of all currently defined settings.

settings.load.name: settings.load([sPath])
settings.load.summary: Load settings from the given file.

settings.save.name: settings.save([sPath])
settings.save.summary: Save settings to the given file.

settings.set.name: settings.set(name, value)
settings.set.summary: Set the value of a setting.

settings.undefine.name: settings.undefine(name)
settings.undefine.summary: Remove a definition of a setting.

settings.unset.name: settings.unset(name)
settings.unset.summary: Remove the value of a setting, setting it to the default.

shell.name: shell
shell.summary: The shell API provides access to CraftOS's command line interface.

shell.aliases.name: shell.aliases()
shell.aliases.summary: Get the current aliases for this shell.

shell.completeProgram.name: shell.completeProgram(program)
shell.completeProgram.summary: Complete the name of a program.

shell.execute.name: shell.execute(command, ...)
shell.execute.summary: Run a program with the supplied arguments.

shell.getCompletionInfo.name: shell.getCompletionInfo()
shell.getCompletionInfo.summary: Get a table containing all completion functions.

shell.getRunningProgram.name: shell.getRunningProgram()
shell.getRunningProgram.summary: Returns the path to the currently running program.

shell.openTab.name: shell.openTab(...)
shell.openTab.summary: Open a new multishell tab running a command.

shell.path.name: shell.path()
shell.path.summary: Set the path where programs are located.

shell.programs.name: shell.programs([include_hidden])
shell.programs.summary: Return a list of all programs on the path.

shell.resolve.name: shell.resolve(path)
shell.resolve.summary: Resolve a relative path to an absolute path.

shell.resolveProgram.name: shell.resolveProgram(command)
shell.resolveProgram.summary: Resolve a program, using the program path and list of aliases.

shell.run.name: shell.run(...)
shell.run.summary: Run a program with the supplied arguments.

shell.setAlias.name: shell.setAlias(command, program)
shell.setAlias.summary: Add an alias for a program.

shell.setCompletionFunction.name: shell.setCompletionFunction(program, complete)
shell.setCompletionFunction.summary: Set the completion function for a program.

shell.switchTab.name: shell.switchTab(id)
shell.switchTab.summary: Switch to the multishell tab with the given index.

sleep.name: sleep(time)
sleep.summary: Pauses execution for the specified number of seconds.

speaker_audio.name: Playing audio with speakers
speaker_audio.summary: CC: Tweaked's speaker peripheral provides a powerful way to play any audio you like with the speaker.playAudio method.

task_complete.name: task_complete
task_complete.summary: The task_complete event is fired when an asynchronous task completes.

term.current.name: term.current()
term.current.summary: Returns the current terminal object of the computer.

term.native.name: term.native()
term.native.summary: Get the native terminal object of the current computer.

term.redirect.name: term.redirect(target)
term.redirect.summary: Redirects terminal output to a monitor, a window, or any other custom terminal object.

term_resize.name: term_resize
term_resize.summary: The term_resize event is fired when the main terminal is resized.

terminate.name: terminate
terminate.summary: The terminate event is fired when Ctrl-T is held down.

textutils.name: textutils
textutils.summary: Helpful utilities for formatting and manipulating strings.

textutils.complete.name: textutils.complete(sSearchText [, tSearchTable])
textutils.complete.summary: Provides a list of possible completions for a partial Lua expression.

textutils.empty_json_array.name: textutils.empty_json_array
textutils.empty_json_array.summary: A table representing an empty JSON array, in order to distinguish it from an empty JSON object.

textutils.formatTime.name: textutils.formatTime(nTime [, bTwentyFourHour])
textutils.formatTime.summary: Takes input time and formats it in a more readable format such as 6:30 PM.

textutils.json_null.name: textutils.json_null
textutils.json_null.summary: A table representing the JSON null value.

textutils.pagedPrint.name: textutils.pagedPrint(text [, free_lines])
textutils.pagedPrint.summary: Prints a given string to the display.

textutils.pagedTabulate.name: textutils.pagedTabulate(...)
textutils.pagedTabulate.summary: Prints tables in a structured form, stopping and prompting for input should the result not fit on the terminal.

textutils.serialise.name: textutils.serialise(t, opts)
textutils.serialise.summary: Convert a Lua object into a textual representation, suitable for saving in a file or pretty-printing.

textutils.serialiseJSON.name: textutils.serialiseJSON(...)
textutils.serialiseJSON.summary: Returns a JSON representation of the given data.

textutils.serialize.name: textutils.serialize(t, opts)
textutils.serialize.summary: Convert a Lua object into a textual representation, suitable for saving in a file or pretty-printing.

textutils.serializeJSON.name: textutils.serializeJSON(...)
textutils.serializeJSON.summary: Returns a JSON representation of the given data.

textutils.slowPrint.name: textutils.slowPrint(sText [, nRate])
textutils.slowPrint.summary: Slowly prints string text at current cursor position, character-by-character.

textutils.slowWrite.name: textutils.slowWrite(text [, rate])
textutils.slowWrite.summary: Slowly writes string text at current cursor position, character-by-character.

textutils.tabulate.name: textutils.tabulate(...)
textutils.tabulate.summary: Prints tables in a structured form.

textutils.unserialise.name: textutils.unserialise(s)
textutils.unserialise.summary: Converts a serialised string back into a reassembled Lua object.

textutils.unserialiseJSON.name: textutils.unserialiseJSON(s [, options])
textutils.unserialiseJSON.summary: Converts a serialised JSON string back into a reassembled Lua object.

textutils.unserialize.name: textutils.unserialize(s)
textutils.unserialize.summary: Converts a serialised string back into a reassembled Lua object.

textutils.unserializeJSON.name: textutils.unserializeJSON(s [, options])
textutils.unserializeJSON.summary: Converts a serialised JSON string back into a reassembled Lua object.

textutils.urlEncode.name: textutils.urlEncode(str)
textutils.urlEncode.summary: Replaces certain characters in a string to make it safe for use in URLs or POST data.

timer.name: timer
timer.summary: The timer event is fired when a timer started with os.startTimer completes.

turtle.craft.name: turtle.craft([limit=64])
turtle.craft.summary: Craft a recipe based on the turtle's inventory.

turtle.native.name: turtle.native
turtle.native.summary: The builtin turtle API, without any generated helper functions.

turtle_inventory.name: turtle_inventory
turtle_inventory.summary: The turtle_inventory event is fired when a turtle's inventory is changed.

using_require.name: Reusing code with require
using_require.summary: A library is a collection of useful functions and other definitions which is stored separately to your main program.

vector.name: vector
vector.summary: A basic 3D vector type and some common vector operations.

vector.Vector.name: vector.Vector
vector.Vector.summary: A 3-dimensional vector, with x, y, and z values.

vector.Vector:cross.name: vector.Vector:cross(o)
vector.Vector:cross.summary: Compute the cross product of two vectors

vector.Vector:div.name: vector.Vector:div(m)
vector.Vector:div.summary: Divides a vector by a scalar value.

vector.Vector:dot.name: vector.Vector:dot(o)
vector.Vector:dot.summary: Compute the dot product of two vectors

vector.Vector:equals.name: vector.Vector:equals(other)
vector.Vector:equals.summary: Check for equality between two vectors.

vector.Vector:length.name: vector.Vector:length()
vector.Vector:length.summary: Get the length (also referred to as magnitude) of this vector.

vector.Vector:mul.name: vector.Vector:mul(m)
vector.Vector:mul.summary: Multiplies a vector by a scalar value.

vector.Vector:normalize.name: vector.Vector:normalize()
vector.Vector:normalize.summary: Divide this vector by its length, producing with the same direction, but of length 1.

vector.Vector:round.name: vector.Vector:round([tolerance])
vector.Vector:round.summary: Construct a vector with each dimension rounded to the nearest value.

vector.Vector:tostring.name: vector.Vector:tostring()
vector.Vector:tostring.summary: Convert this vector into a string, for pretty printing.

vector.new.name: vector.new(x, y, z)
vector.new.summary: Construct a new Vector with the given coordinates.

websocket_closed.name: websocket_closed
websocket_closed.summary: The websocket_closed event is fired when an open WebSocket connection is closed.

websocket_failure.name: websocket_failure
websocket_failure.summary: The websocket_failure event is fired when a WebSocket connection request fails.

websocket_message.name: websocket_message
websocket_message.summary: The websocket_message event is fired when a message is received on an open WebSocket connection.

websocket_success.name: websocket_success
websocket_success.summary: The websocket_success event is fired when a WebSocket connection request returns successfully.

window.name: window
window.summary: A terminal redirect occupying a smaller area of an existing terminal.

window.Window.getLine.name: window.Window.getLine(y)
window.Window.getLine.summary: Get the buffered contents of a line in this window.

window.Window.getPosition.name: window.Window.getPosition()
window.Window.getPosition.summary: Get the position of the top left corner of this window.

window.Window.isVisible.name: window.Window.isVisible()
window.Window.isVisible.summary: Get whether this window is visible.

window.Window.reposition.name: window.Window.reposition(new_x, new_y [, new_width, new_height [, new_parent]])
window.Window.reposition.summary: Reposition or resize the given window.

window.Window.restoreCursor.name: window.Window.restoreCursor()
window.Window.restoreCursor.summary: Set the current terminal's cursor to where this window's cursor is.

window.Window.setVisible.name: window.Window.setVisible(visible)
window.Window.setVisible.summary: Set whether this window is visible.

window.create.name: window.create(parent, nX, nY, nWidth, nHeight [, bStartVisible])
window.create.summary: Returns a terminal object that is a space within the specified parent terminal object.

write.name: write(text)
write.summary: Writes a line of text to the screen without a newline at the end, wrapping text if necessary.
